meanings.definition: The quality or state of being serious and dignified.
meanings.sent1: Her staidnesses during the meeting impressed everyone with her professionalism.
meanings.sent2: The staidnesses of the judge's demeanor commanded respect in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: Despite his usual playfulness, his staidnesses at the funeral showed his deep respect.
meanings.sent4: The staidnesses of the old oak tree reminded me of the strength in silence.
meanings.sent5: The staidnesses of the ancient library made it feel like a sanctuary of knowledge.

meanings.definition: The act of being settled or fixed in character.
meanings.sent1: The staidnesses of his personality made him a reliable friend.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the staidnesses of her beliefs became evident to those around her.
meanings.sent3: His sudden staidnesses in behavior surprised his friends, who were used to his wild antics.
meanings.sent4: The staidnesses of the mountain range gave it an air of permanence and strength.
meanings.sent5: The staidnesses of the old clock reminded her of the passage of time.
